intro: Lactuca procumbens, commonly known as匍匐莴苣 or prostrate lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of less than 10 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves that are often bluish-green in color. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Lactuca procumbens is native to Europe and Asia but has been introduced to other regions, where it can sometimes become invasive.
